SENT.plain: Idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH) is characterized by symptoms and signs of elevated intracranial pressure, elevated cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure, normal CSF content, and normal brain with normal or small ventricles on neuroimaging studies
IIH in children has a wide spectrum of clinical presentation
Diagnostic criteria with modifications to adapt to the variations in children are discussed
Diagnostic and therapeutic options are reviewed
